(1 John #17) New Birth: New Behaviour
description: Glyn Owen shares on 3 points in this message, 1. Christ shall appear. 2. We shall see him as He is. 3. We shall be like Him. If we are partakers of the divine nature and of the new birth we will be like Him on this earth and when we come to glory in heaven. There is need to see new behavior for those who have experienced the new birth.

First thing is First
For the Love of Christ Constraineth Us
description: Glyn Owen beautifully and forcefully brings the text upon us 'For the Love of Christ Constraineth Us.' There is something not just in the words of this sermon but the spirit behind it that makes it effectual to the mind that hears it. Do we understand something of the experience of Paul the Apostle in this text? Are you constrained, compelled by God? Are you serving yourself or are you dead to yourself and serving the Living God?

Power Or True Religion
Power of True Religion: Power Over Us
Power of True Religion: Power Through Us
description: J. Glyn Owen speaks about what true religion is. He speaks of the work of the Holy Spirit in the believer and not simply a holding to doctrinal viewpoints but the life of God through us, His power. God manifests His purpose through believers to see His salvation reach others. He shares that our experience of power with God is not a selfish personal experience but for God's greater purpose. Lastly he ties in the Gospel and shares that this is God's ultimate larger picture beyond our own personal experiences for ourselves.

Sermon on the Mount: Salt of the Earth
description: From the scripture Matthew 5:14, Glyn Owen frankly and honestly shows the spiritual signifigance of these words from our masters lips. It is shown that in our day and age there is a landslide of immortality that overshadows anything that has happened in the near past. Children in society are being raised with high mental and physical standards but morally are being feed sewage in contrast. He gives a very straight forward call for the Church to be that positive agent, saline and different then the world so we can have a positive effect on it morally and bring glory to the name of God. He mentions about Holiness and many other things, this sermon is one of utmost importance to listen to for the nomial Chrisitan in our day.

What Child Is This? The Benedictus
description: J. Glyn Owen speaks on the wonderful words of Zacharias that the Lord has come to redeem the people. The beginning of light is shining in the advent season, John the Baptist is showing the way to our Saviour.  The Benedictus was the song of thanksgiving uttered by Zechariah on the occasion of the circumcision of his son, John the Baptist. The canticle received its name from its first words in Latin (Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel, â€œBlessed be the Lord God of Israelâ€).
